Title: They are sleeping
Kanji: さくら： 次　は　新宿　駅　です。さお　降りましょう
ロドリゴ：　あれ、あの　人たち、寝て　います
アンナ: 大丈夫　かな
さくら：大丈夫, 大丈夫。ほら、起きた
Kana: さくら： つぎ　は　しんじゅく　えく　です。さお　おりましょう
ロドリゴ　あれ、あの　ひとたち、ねて　います
アンナ: だいじょうぶ　かな
さくら：だいじょうぶ, だいじょうぶ.　ほら、おきた
Romaji: Sakura: Tshugi wa Shinjuku eki desu. Sā, Orimashou
Rodorigo: Are. Ano hito tachi, nete imasu.
English: Sakura: The next station is Shinjuku. Now, let's get off.
Rodrigo: Look, those people are sleeping.
Anna: I wonder if they are all right.
Sakura: They are all right. Look! They've woken up.
Vocabulary: 新宿　駅 (しんじゅく　えく - Shinjuku Eki) = Shinjuku station.
人たち (ひとたち - Hito tachi) = People, Plurar of person
大丈夫 (だいじょうぶ - Daijōbu) = All right, adjetive meaning free from dangers.
かな (Kana) = Expresion to ask yourself something
起きた (おきた - Okita) =To have Woken up. Ta form of verb おきます (Okimasu) = To wake up
Description: If you change the ます(part) of a verb by  ましょう(Mashou), you are making a proposal.
This form can only be used in situations where you are sure that people won't refuse the proposal
- ここ　で　おります (Koko de orimasu) = We will get off here.
- ここ　で　おりましょう (Koko de orimashou) = Let's get off here
